persona.name: Maria Lopez
persona.description: Maria is a 45-year-old librarian based in a small urban community. She has a master's degree in Library and Information Science and has been working in public libraries for over 20 years. She has extensive experience curating fiction collections that appeal to diverse community groups and actively engages in local reading clubs. Maria is technologically proficient, comfortable using digital cataloging tools and social media to promote reading events. Her perspective focuses on making fiction accessible and culturally relevant for community members, which can inform the ontology on community engagement and diverse readership needs.

persona.name: Maria Lopez
persona.description: A retired librarian in her early 70s from Madrid, Maria has an extensive knowledge of classic and contemporary fiction. She has spent decades curating and recommending books, making her highly aware of genre conventions and reader preferences.
